{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3423289,"name":"Poyraz Aygül","username":"poaygul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/poaygul/{size}/235100_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T06:38:52.730Z","cooked":"

We are back from summer holiday and we weren’t active during the season. Now for our off-season project we are working on 3D printed treads but we have a small problem

Our Rev 3in MAXSwerve’s wheel shaft is stuck. Theres visibly rust inside but we can’t solve it using any rust remover. We also don’t want to put any pressure on it since it would be quite bad if the shaft would be bad for us.

We currently can’t change the wheels and they’re completely stuck. Here are some images for you us to explain the situation better:

WhatsApp Image 2024-09-13 at 09.33.061200×1600 95.7 KB

WhatsApp Image 2024-09-13 at 09.33.071200×1600 80.3 KB

Any solves, recommendations? + Any tips for future wheel sets?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T06:39:14.250Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":20,"reads":280,"readers_count":279,"score":156.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Poyraz Aygül","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60521,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/1","custom_user_title":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3423291,"name":"s-neff","username":"s-neff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/s-neff/{size}/9062_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T07:02:26.615Z","cooked":"

If this was my problem I would try applying a little penetrating oil and putting it in an arbor press.
A 1/2ton arbor press should be <$100 from harbor freight, and is worth the investment.

Maybe try knocking it with a dead blow mallet or rubber hammer, if you don’t have a press.

Don’t use a standard hammer or metal sledge, those will deform the steel.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T07:03:25.312Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":258,"readers_count":257,"score":86.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423292,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T07:05:10.861Z","cooked":"

In this case, I think you’re going to have to put pressure on the shaft. There are ways to do that without damaging it, though.

Do you have any sort of hydraulic or arbor press available? You’ll also want a chunk of brass or maybe aluminum that’s just a little smaller diameter than the shaft, and possibly some chunky wood. Load the press like you’re trying to just press the shaft out, but instead of pressing on the shaft, stick the brass in between the press and the shaft. If there’s deformation it’ll deform the brass. The wood is there to protect the rest of the wheel (especially the gear) as needed.

All you really need is to get it moving. Once it’s moving, it should keep moving more freely.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T07:05:10.861Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":247,"readers_count":246,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/3","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423293,"name":"","username":"DaiTou567","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/b487fb/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T07:06:48.780Z","cooked":"

In this case it might be good to remove the bevel gear first before pressing. Assuming that there is no rusting to the screws.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T07:06:48.780Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":233,"readers_count":232,"score":61.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64070,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2429 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/4","custom_user_title":"2429 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423294,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T07:36:17.791Z","cooked":"

You can also improvise a press with a vise and a socket as a driver with another (larger) socket as a receiver on the other end, or in a case where there’s a through-hole, you can often use a long threaded rod/bolt in a similar sandwich and use the nut to drive the shaft out.

If pressing (straight) damages the shaft, you were already out of luck and just hadn’t realized it yet. In all likelihood, it will press out smoothly and successfully.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T07:36:17.791Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":69.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/5","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423299,"name":"SndMndBdy","username":"SndMndBdy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T08:26:40.028Z","cooked":"

Try removing the 6 bolts that hold the bevel gear onto the plate on the opposite side of the wheel. That may provide you with enough wiggle to get things apart easier.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T08:26:40.028Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":42.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"SndMndBdy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20008,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423317,"name":"Poyraz Aygül","username":"poaygul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/poaygul/{size}/235100_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T12:00:53.812Z","cooked":"

We dont own any kind of presses and yes we have tried removing the bolts. We can’t even take out the bevel gear. The photos were taken afterwards. Also, penetrating oil is what I mean by a “rust remover”. Tomorrow we will try what @sokoloff said and come back with more news. Thank you all

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T12:02:24.451Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":197,"readers_count":196,"score":49.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Poyraz Aygül","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66298,"username":"sokoloff","name":"Jim Sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60521,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/7","custom_user_title":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423320,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T12:27:47.155Z","cooked":"

If the shaft is damaged beyond repair when you do get the shaft out, I’d reach out to REV and explain what happened. Hopefully they can help you out.

We were pretty disappointed last year when we ordered a third set of modules (our previous two sets were from the 2023 season when they first launched), and found that REV had changed a number of their parts to steel (most steel parts were rusting out of the box, including some of the shafts with very noticeable pitting on the surface). I’m a little worried for our team too when we go to service our newer swerve modules this fall after they’ve been sitting all summer in a hot, humid school…

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T12:30:04.946Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":90.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/rev-rust-robotics/450727","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Rev Rust Robotics?","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60521,"username":"poaygul","name":"Poyraz Aygül","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/poaygul/{size}/235100_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/8","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423323,"name":"Mr. Siefen | 453","username":"kingc95","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kingc95/{size}/226662_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T12:32:03.389Z","cooked":"
cad321:

steel parts were rusting out of the box, including some of the shafts with very noticeable pitting on the surface

We had a similar issue, but @Greg_Needel and the support team at REV sent us new replacement pieces on request after we followed the washing instructions and still had one or two bad pieces.

I agree though this was not a fun experience, and I’m not looking forward to seeing what our modules will look like either when we get back.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T12:32:03.389Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":170,"readers_count":169,"score":69.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Mr. Siefen | 453","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20632,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mr. Siefen"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/9","custom_user_title":"Mr. Siefen","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423328,"name":"Will C","username":"Suppdog222","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/suppdog222/{size}/256515_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T12:54:22.455Z","cooked":"

If you don’t have a press available you could always take the part to harbor freight or Lowes and “test out” an arbor press that’s on display. They usually don’t mind and it works great in a pinch

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T12:54:22.455Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Will C","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60521,"username":"poaygul","name":"Poyraz Aygül","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/poaygul/{size}/235100_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66211,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3176 Risk Mitigation Specialist + 3D Printing Lead + Fabrication and Design"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/10","custom_user_title":"3176 Risk Mitigation Specialist + 3D Printing Lead + Fabrication and Design","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423330,"name":"tkchan","username":"tkchan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T12:56:41.066Z","cooked":"

If you plan on doing your own printed 3d wheels, I would highly recommended buying up 2-3 sets of those spare parts so you have them ready to swap. That way you are just 1 bolt to swap wheels in between matches. [Make sure you are using the wheels with the bump/cut out for the bearing].

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T12:56:41.066Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":51.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"tkchan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26389,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"think outside of the box from time to time"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/11","custom_user_title":"think outside of the box from time to time","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423378,"name":"Poyraz Aygül","username":"poaygul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/poaygul/{size}/235100_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T16:39:54.452Z","cooked":"

We’re located in Turkey so shipping will be a big problem for us. But we are %100 going to try reaching out to REV.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-13T17:05:29.156Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":144,"readers_count":143,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Poyraz Aygül","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":26389,"username":"tkchan","name":"tkchan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ee59a6/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60521,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/12","custom_user_title":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423388,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-13T17:25:21.384Z","cooked":"

I believe the bearings are standard and could be sourced from anyone who can supply Imperial sized bearings in Türkiye. The shaft is quite simple and could probably be made quite easily if you have a lathe or there is a machine shop you can work with locally. Of course if you can get the parts from REV that would be ideal, but it might end up being faster or easier to get the parts locally rather than importing them.

You might also use a large C-clamp (or a ball joint press) if you can’t get a vise around the whole assembly.

Today we got the parts out of the axle without damaging it, thanks to @sokoloff .

But unfortunately the module is completely unusable. Theres rust in the axle, the bearings and other partly at some places such as the bevel gear etc. We contacted REV Robotics and currently waiting for a response. Hope we get some replacement parts before the season.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-15T12:16:40.423Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":55.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Poyraz Aygül","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60521,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/15","custom_user_title":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3423872,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-15T13:44:52.687Z","cooked":"

Playing devil’s advocate - does your robot live near the coast?

Steel rusts. It’s a well known phenomenon - and robots are shipped sometimes over the water where they are exposed to salt water which accelerates rusting.

Is this really a warranty issue for Rev.? Or is this a foreseeable environmental condition that your team should be frequently coating these parts in a water displacement oil for longer life, or planning on replacement periodically?

One could argue the design could be more rust resistant, perhaps coating the shaft or something, but there are components in that assembly that can’t be reliably coated (bearings) that will likely see the same failures for you in future years. And even the parts that can be coated are likely to wear and quickly rust after that.

I don’t know how Rev. could afford to sell you modules 1 time, then replace the parts inside indefinitely year after year if this is being caused by your particular environmental conditions and is a known physical property of the part materials. Seems like although “unequal”, teams with exaggerating environmental conditions should be taking more care to lengthen the parts lifespan that their environment may be unfairly shortening.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-15T13:44:52.687Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":93.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60521,"username":"poaygul","name":"Poyraz Aygül","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/poaygul/{size}/235100_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/16","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424257,"name":"Poyraz Aygül","username":"poaygul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/poaygul/{size}/235100_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-16T19:34:30.695Z","cooked":"

Sad ending. REV Robotics responded and told us our guarantee was over since the swerves were bought in the 2023 season. REV Recommended we buy new modules/parts, so our path from now on will be buying as few new parts as we can, brute forcing the old ones out with as little damage as possible, and waiting hoping they’ll get in our hands before the season starts. This will be costly but this will be our way. We will ask local teams to use their lathe to produce the axle and get the bearings from China as a backup plan. (In a scenario where the parts can’t get past the customs)

We’re quite sad that we acted impatient and didn’t wait for SDS swerves to get in stock. For now, thank you all for the help.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-16T19:44:16.902Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":18.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Poyraz Aygül","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60521,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/17","custom_user_title":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"cry","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424263,"name":"Poyraz Aygül","username":"poaygul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/poaygul/{size}/235100_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-16T19:57:14.937Z","cooked":"

We’re based in Istanbul, but farther away from the Bosphorus compared to other teams. We bought the first version of the swerve so we acknowledged that we’ll face some problems, but didn’t think about the future. We tried our best for the robot not to rust, we put a cloth on it on rainy days to reduce the risk of dew and preserved any humidity that was possible to preserve. The closest the bot’s ever been to water was in Esenler Robot Yarışları, Turkey which was about a year ago where the tent the competition was organized in received heavy rain. We should’ve taken more precautions maybe, but we learned it the hard way.

Hope this topic will provide experience to new teams and people who risk facing rust in any part of the robot.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":20,"updated_at":"2024-09-16T19:58:12.847Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":13.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471173,"topic_slug":"rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck","display_username":"Poyraz Aygül","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63541,"username":"Jwal","name":"Joseph Walters","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60521,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy"},"post_url":"/t/rev-3in-maxswerve-wheel-shaft-stuck/471173/18","custom_user_title":"7840 Driver, Electrical, Strategy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424265,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-16T20:03:15.198Z","cooked":"

The SDS bearings look similar/the same type so you still would have had rust in the same place.

The shaft looks to be a black oxide coated bolt however, so perhaps less rust on that part/in that area.

Having backup parts is a good plan in general for repair, this will just have to be some of your annual or semi-annual maintenance. Perhaps consider wiping these down quarterly or semi-annually with an oil cloth, the wheels are easy enough to drop out of the assembly to do this maintenance.
